meanings.definition: A discoloration of the skin resulting from bleeding underneath, typically caused by bruising.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the patient's ecchymoses to determine the extent of the bruising.
meanings.sent2: Her ecchymoses from the fall were starting to fade after a few days.
meanings.sent3: The ecchymoses on his arm looked like little purple clouds floating on his skin.
meanings.sent4: The ecchymoses on her leg painted a vivid picture of the impact of the injury.
meanings.sent5: The child pointed to his ecchymoses, asking his mom why his skin had turned dark.

meanings.sent1: The doctor noted multiple ecchymoses on the patient's body, indicating widespread bruising.
meanings.sent2: The nurse recorded the ecchymoses in the medical report for accurate documentation.
meanings.sent3: Seeing all the ecchymoses together made the patient feel like a walking rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The ecchymoses dotted her skin like tiny purple stars in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The ecchymoses stood out like colorful patches on a quilt, each telling a different story.
